annotated_bib.problem_stmt: In Boston today any outdated public transporation system known as the MBTA is using older train cars to hold its passengers. The space in these cars fill up quickly and eventually there is no where for these people to go.

citation.author: Grabar, H.
citation.title: Subway Cars Should Be Like Centipedes

annotation.background: This article by the Slate, a popular magazine that examines and analyzes issues in today's society,
annotation.summary: takes a look at space situation with subway systems in America. The article first examines why subway cars are becoming so overcrowded in these American cities. Afterwards it looks at the solutions other cities like Paris, Tokyo and Toronto have done to fix this issue.
annotation.relevance: What the author finds to be the best solution to improving the space in these subway cars is having gangway trains instead of the string of separate cars that attach to one and another.

citation.author: Annear, S.
citation.title: MBTA Orange Line Trains Will Be Replaced, Red Line Vehicles Added.

annotation.background: The article, written by Steve Annear a digital writer at Boston Magazine graduate from Roger Williams University former writer at Boston Metro newspaper,
annotation.summary: discusses the newly passed bill that will improve the MBTA system. The article discusses how both the Orange and Red line will both have new sets of vehicles that will provide more seating and space for riders. The planned timetable for these improvements are to be avaliable by 2019.
annotation.relevance: For people already using the subway and train systems these new additions to the Orange and Red line will provide them a more comfortable riding experience. These new improvements may also lead to more timely and accurate scheduling that will lead to less delays and faster commutes.
